definitions.definition: An opportunity to test something out; a test.
definitions.example: They will perform the trials for the new equipment next week.

definitions.definition: Appearance at judicial court in order to be examined.

definitions.example: That boy was a trial to his parents.

definitions.definition: A tryout to pick members of a team.
A piece of ware used to test the heat of a kiln.
An internal examination set by Eton College.
To carry out a series of tests on (a new product, procedure etc.) before marketing or implementing it.
definitions.example: The warning system was extensively trialed before being fitted to all our vehicles.

definitions.definition: To try out (a new player) in a sports team.
definitions.example: The team trialled a new young goalkeeper in Saturday's match, with mixed results.
